data.title: Content loading capitalization policy different on Windows and Linux
data.body:
I don't know about OSX, but I know that the capitalization policy is different on Windows and Linux as far as content loading goes. On Windows, `Content.Load<Texture2D>(@"Tiles/Null")` will load `Tiles/null.xnb` even though capitalization is different, however this is not true for Linux. On Linux, it will throw a "Cannot load as non-content file" error unless the image is renamed to `Null.xnb` or the line that loads it is changed to use lowercase.

What is the correct policy? I am inclined to agree with the more strict one that is implemented on Linux.

As a note, this may impact the Linux/WinGL merge.

data.title: Master
three isses with SharpDX/MediaPlayer (MonoGame 3.4.0.456)
data.body:
[edit] after playing around more, I discovered that the problems I was having locally are due to inconsistent application of Volume settings. This is a DIFFERENT sort of bug, and I uncovered an additional bug after further testing. I have edited the post accordingly.

---

I installed CrashReporter.NET into my project recently, and have been getting several reports related to MediaPlayer. I'm unable to reproduce these locally, but I've noticed some MediaPlayer issues of my own, and I have to wonder if they could be related.

First, the issues I have locally:

I am using MonoGame 3.4.0.456. My machine runs 64-bit Windows 7.
1. The first time a song is played, I receive "A first chance exception of type 'SharpDX.SharpDXException' occurred in SharpDX.dll". The game continues running as normal for me, however I wonder if this is the cause for some of the crashes I've had reported via CrashReporter.NET (below).
2. I set MediaPlayer.Volume every time a song is played, however the first time a particular song is played, this Volume is not respected; the song plays at 100% Volume. Subsequent plays of the same song respect the Volume I've set, but every time a song is played that has never been played before, the Volume is set back to full. (MonoGame seems to have some memory of Volume on a per-song basis, which fails to be applied the first time??) When a song loops - via MediaPlayer.IsRepeating = true - this seems to count as a second playthrough, and the previously-set Volume suddenly applies itself! I tried moving the code that sets MediaPlayer.Volume to both before and after the MediaPlayer.Play(...) call, but in both places, these symptoms remain.
3. Sometimes, a song simply refuses to play. This seems to happen randomly, to any song. There is no message in the console, or any other indication that something went wrong, and MediaPlayer.Status reports that the song is Playing.
4. I created a sound/song test menu within my game to facilitate easily testing the above.

Second: two MediaPlayer-related issues have been reported via CrashReporter.NET, but I have not been able to reproduce them locally. Here are the stack traces; I've truncated them at the point where it gets into my code, since I imagine that's not useful, but I can get the full stack traces including those, if it WOULD be helpful:

This report has only come from Windows 7 machines. I can't necessarily tell how many are UNIQUE reports, but I saw two different versions of .NET (4.0.30319.34209 and 4.0.30319.18063), so there are at least two unique versions (unless one player attempted to upgrade .NET to solve the issue?)

```
SharpDX.SharpDXException: HRESULT: [0x80004002], Module: [General], ApiCode: [E_NOINTERFACE/No such interface supported], Message: No such interface supported
 at SharpDX.Result.CheckError()
 at SharpDX.MediaFoundation.MediaFactory.GetService(ComObject unkObjectRef, Guid guidService, Guid riid, IntPtr& vObjectOut)
 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Media.MediaPlayer.GetVolumeObj(MediaSession session)
 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Media.MediaPlayer.PlatformPlaySong(Song song)
 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Media.MediaPlayer.Play(Song song)
```

AND:

This report has only come from machines running Vista. Similar to the first stacktrace, I can't be sure about the uniqueness of each report, but there are again two unique versions of .NET: 4.0.30319.34209 and 4.0.30319.18444.

```
SharpDX.SharpDXException: HRESULT: [0xC00D36E3], Module: [Unknown], ApiCode: [Unknown/Unknown], Message: Unknown
 at SharpDX.Result.CheckError()
 at SharpDX.MediaFoundation.MediaFactory.Startup(Int32 version, Int32 dwFlags)
 at SharpDX.MediaFoundation.MediaManager.Startup(Boolean useLightVersion)
 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Media.MediaManagerState.CheckStartup()
 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Media.Song.PlatformInitialize(String fileName)
 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Media.Song..ctor(String fileName)
 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Media.Song..ctor(String fileName, Int32 durationMS)
 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.SongReader.Read(ContentReader input, Song existingInstance)
 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentTypeReader`1.Read(ContentReader input, Object existingInstance)
 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentReader.InnerReadObject[T](T existingInstance)
 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentReader.ReadObject[T](T existingInstance)
 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentReader.ReadObject[T]()
 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentReader.ReadAsset[T]()
 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentManager.ReadAsset[T](String assetName, Action`1 recordDisposableObject)
 at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentManager.Load[T](String assetName)
```

If there's any other information I can provide, please let me know.

Crash in Mac OSX - GamePad
data.body:
Current Development branch as of May 25 When overriding the update method in the Game:

```
    protected override void Update(GameTime gameTime)
    {
        base.Update(gameTime);

        // Allows the game to exit
        #if (WINDOWS && !NETFX_CORE) || WINDOWSGL || WINDOWSDX || MACOS
        if (GamePad.GetState(PlayerIndex.One).Buttons.Back == ButtonState.Pressed)
        Exit();
        #endif
    }
```

Calling the GamePad.GetState here causes the following crash:

2015-05-25 08:53:10.820 CocosSharpTests[53100:1772618] _createMenuRef called with existing principal MenuRef already associated with menu
2015-05-25 08:53:10.821 CocosSharpTests[53100:1772618] (
    0   CoreFoundation                      0x90fe2c63 __raiseError + 195
    1   libobjc.A.dylib                     0x9aa73a2a objc_exception_throw + 276
    2   CoreFoundation                      0x90fe2b7d +[NSException raise:format:] + 141
    3   AppKit                              0x95fe2193 -[NSCarbonMenuImpl _createMenuRef] + 70
    4   AppKit                              0x95fe1924 -[NSCarbonMenuImpl _instantiateCarbonMenu] + 155
    5   AppKit                              0x95fe187e -[NSCarbonMenuImpl setupCarbonMenuBar] + 40
    6   AppKit                              0x95fdfddd -[NSApplication finishLaunching] + 1398
    7   ???                                 0x104b3204 0x0 + 273363460
    8   ???                                 0x104b2094 0x0 + 273358996
    9   ???                                 0x027ddc40 0x0 + 41802816
    10  libUnable to determine number of joysticks.
Object reference not set to an instance of an object
mono-2.0.dylib                   0x0040ec8f mono_jit_runtime_invoke + 751
    11  libmono-2.0.dylib                   0x005d0baf mono_runtime_invoke + 127
    12  libmono-2.0.dylib                   0x005d10da mono_runtime_class_init_full + 778
    13  libmono-2.0.dylib                   0x0040bc17 mono_jit_compile_method_with_opt + 4119
    14  libmono-2.0.dylib                   0x0040aba9 mono_jit_compile_method + 57
    15  libmono-2.0.dylib                   0x004c0d91 common_call_trampoline + 961
    16  libmono-2.0.dylib                   0x004c09bc mono_magic_trampoline + 60
    17  ???                                 0x007ef088 0x0 + 8319112

The calling line is https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Input/GamePad.OpenTK.cs#L84

data.title: Open audio content files in read mode
data.body:
Using FileStream to open files, FileAccess.Read must be specified so it can handle files that are flagged as read-only. These are found in source control systems such as Perforce, among others.

Fixes #3873

data.title: Exception Processing ReadOnly WAV
data.body:
The code here...

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/Audio/AudioContent.cs#L301

Needs to be fixed to open that stream in read only mode.

data.title: Content pipeline implementation isn't exposed
data.body:
As a user who is trying to implement Content Pipeline Extension that deals with graphics, I'm unable to reproduce things like Texture2DReader, because ContentReader.GraphicsDevice is internal.

In my use case, I'm trying to implement TextureAtlas content pipeline extension. It reads TextureAtlas which contains dictionary of regions and an image. I'm not able to initiate new Texture2D, because I can't get handle to a GraphicsDevice.

To reproduce this, copy contents of https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Content/ContentReaders/Texture2DReader.cs to a custom extension. It doesn't compile.

data.title: Content.mgcb build fail when code is from a GIT repository.
data.body:
Hi to all,

I started a little project, and I started in one computer, and I made a GIT repository and I commited all the project in the GIT, when I downloaded the repository (in other/same computer) I can't build it, and monogame gives me this fail.
###### The command ""C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\MonoGame\v3.0\Tools\MGCB.exe" /@:"C:\Users\Eduardo.Izquierdo\Documents\Piribisoft%20Airlines%20Game\com.piribisoft.airlines.windows\Content\Content.mgcb" /platform:Windows /outputDir:"C:\Users\Eduardo.Izquierdo\Documents\Piribisoft%20Airlines%20Game\com.piribisoft.airlines.windows\Content\bin\Windows" /intermediateDir:"C:\Users\Eduardo.Izquierdo\Documents\Piribisoft%20Airlines%20Game\com.piribisoft.airlines.windows\Content\obj\Windows" /quiet" exited with code -532462766.

I found another issue with the same problem, but I tried all the solutions, with the same result. I checked and reinstalled the same version of MonoGame (3.4) in both computers, but the problems also happens in the same computer. Also I checked the MonoGameContentReference, but is OK in all the cases.

The fun is at if I copy the "original" solution, in other folder it's works, and if I copy the solution into a pendrive and I move to the other computer is also works. Any idea? I can't understand this. I uploaded to my git repository without any .gitignore, so all the files are uploaded, but it continues failing.

It's crazy.

Can you help me people?

Thank you so much.

data.title: Nuget MonoGame.Framework.iOS can't be installed
data.body:
It's my first attempt to use Monogame, so maybe I do something wrong!
Here is what I have done:

1) Create new Xamarin.iOS blank app Iphone (NOT classic API) using VS2013 and a Xamarin.iOS business edition.
2) In "Manage Nuget Packages...", install "MonoGame.Framework.iOS" (v3.4.459)

Then I get this :
Installing 'MonoGame.Framework.iOS 3.4.0.459'.
Successfully installed 'MonoGame.Framework.iOS 3.4.0.459'.
Adding 'MonoGame.Framework.iOS 3.4.0.459' to App8.
Uninstalling 'MonoGame.Framework.iOS 3.4.0.459'.
Successfully uninstalled 'MonoGame.Framework.iOS 3.4.0.459'.
Install failed. Rolling back...
Could not install package 'MonoGame.Framework.iOS 3.4.0.459'. You are trying to install this package into a project that targets 'Xamarin.iOS,Version=v1.0', but the package does not contain any assembly references or content files that are compatible with that framework. For more information, contact the package author.

I have latest Monogame 3.4 installed, and latest stable Xamarin.iOS installed 8.10.0.0

So is it a temporary limitation/problem in the Monogame iOS nuget, a problem with my configuration, or something I do wrong?

Note that in "new project/monogame", I don't see Monoagme iOS Project listed. Maybe is it normal, I don't know.

Problem with compiling 3d models
data.body:
http://community.monogame.net/t/wont-load-non-content-fbx-in-monogame-3-4-0-455-on-linux/2455

I've looked into that and it turns out models compiled from Linux can't be loaded, while those compiled from Windows can.

No errors occur during the build of the model.

data.title: [Gtk Pipeline] Changed Save As dialog no button to say no instead of close without saving
data.body: Save as dialog can be called when the project is not saved and user clicks on build., when I modified it last time I forgot about it.

data.title: [Gtk Pipeline] Fixed null crash when viewing project properties
data.body:
Because of https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/TargetPlatform.cs#L100 when WindowsGL or Linux were read they were automatically repinted to DesktopGL, and then with the old Dictionary creating code it was trying to add multiple DesktopGL keys which in turn caused a crash. This fixes it.

Also I can't check if WindowsGL and Linux are obsolete anymore because of the same reason.
